security_rating_rationale: Strong security architecture with 10+ OpenZeppelin audits, zero hacks since 2021, innovative intent-based design eliminating honeypot risks. Downgraded from A due to: (1) recent governance manipulation allegations, (2) reliance on external UMA oracle infrastructure, (3) some audit issues remain acknowledged but unresolved.

uma_integration.mechanism: 1-of-N security model - requires only one honest actor to dispute invalid claims

key_findings: Critical: Valid duplicate fills could be executed leading to fund loss
Hash derivation differences between SpokePool versions

optimistic_relaying_mechanism.description: Intent-based architecture where relayers compete to fulfill user bridge requests
process: 1. User submits bridge request (intent) on source chain
2. Relayers compete to fulfill by fronting funds on destination chain
3. Dataworker aggregates fulfilled intents into repayment bundle
4. Bundle submitted to UMA's Optimistic Oracle for verification
5. Dispute window allows anyone to challenge invalid claims
6. If unchallenged, relayers are reimbursed from liquidity pool
optimistic_relaying_mechanism.speed: Most users receive funds in under 3 seconds
optimistic_relaying_mechanism.gas_efficiency: O(1) scaling for repayment vs O(N) in traditional approaches

relayer_mechanism.role: Front capital for user transfers, earn fees upon verification
relayer_mechanism.bonding: Relayers must post bond as security
relayer_mechanism.competition: Market-driven competition creates natural security incentives
relayer_mechanism.risk_bearing: Relayers temporarily assume risk for user benefit
